refnamediv.refpurpose: Read signals from a file at i-rate.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Read signals from a file at i-rate.

refsect1.title: Syntax
refsect1.synopsis: fini ifilename, iskipframes, iformat, in1 [, in2] [, in3] [, ...]

refsect1.title: Initialization
refsect1.para: ifilename -- input file name (can be a string or a handle number generated by fiopen)
iskipframes -- number of frames to skip at the start (every frame contains a sample of each channel)

iformat -- a number specifying the input file format. If a header is found, this argument is ignored.
0 - floating points in text format (loop; see below)
1 - floating points in text format (no loop; see below)
2 - 32 bit floating points in binary format (no loop)

refsect1.title: Performance
refsect1.para: fini is the complement of fouti and foutir. It reads the values each time the corresponding instrument note is activated. When iformat is set to 0 and the end of file is reached, the file pointer is zeroed. This restarts the scan from the beginning. When iformat is set to 1 or 2, no looping is enabled and at the end of file the corresponding variables will be filled with zeroes.

note.para: Please note that since this opcode generates its output using input parameters (on the right side of the opcode), these variables must be initialized before use, otherwise a 'used before defined' error will occur. You can use the init opcode for this.
